intro: Micromeria, commonly known as sand verbena, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Geraniaceae. These plants are typically small shrubs or herbs, often found in arid and semi-arid regions. They are characterized by their small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Micromeria species are adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in harsh, dry environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
